result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald E. Potapenko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant granted a payment plan of $50.00 per month to begin 11-10-2015

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald E. Potapenko

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Donald E. Potapenko, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson. An agreement reached

Final pre-trial at 10-15-2015 08:40 am.
Jury trial at 11-23-2015 08:30 am.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Donald E. Potapenko, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  No agreement reached  Jury trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:40 am.

Pre-trial conference at 08-10-2015 03:00 pm.
Status conference at 09-03-2015 01:50 pm.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Donald E. Potapenko, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:50 pm.
FOR ONE O'CLOCK APPEARANCE FROM SHERIFF'S DEPT.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is not to have any violent, abusive or otherwise disorderly contact with S.B.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
